No one ever called.I've now replaced the hose with one that was half the price and will either be giving this away to someone with much better water pressure or simply throwing it away. author: Bruce Labitt
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2019
review_content: I bought this to replace an aging hose on a hose reel..  The cheap vinyl hose had oozed plasticizer onto the reel. This gunk took a long time to scrape off and clean.  I thought this hose would be a decent replacement.  I was wrong.Although this is marketed as a 5/8" hose, the female end of the hose is restricted to 0.432", as measured by a Starrett dial vernier caliper.  (Measured in both x and y axis)  This is really small in diameter.  Actually, the area of the hose is 2.09 times bigger than the area of the restriction.  Yes, that means the area of the restriction is less than 1/2 of the main hose.  Come on, Flexilla, you can do better than that!For me this means that a standard spring meant for a rotating hose reel which is 0.450" in diameter cannot be used.  The spring is to prevent the hose from collapsing when it makes a tight radius turn in the hose reel.  The spring cannot fit through the restriction.  The hose is not fit for the purpose that I bought it for.  I suppose I could cut off the end and put on a "real" hose end.  On a brand new hose?  Kind of crappy to have to fix a design defect on a new product.You would think buying a hose would be easy.  I never even thought I'd have to watch out for "cheating" undersized hose ends.  Just looking at a few descriptions of hoses, they never mention hose end diameters, either here on Amazon, or elsewhere.  Why is that?  THAT'S BECAUSE THE HOSE ENDS ARE SUPPOSED TO BE THE SAME DIAMETER AS THE HOSE!  Or at least close.  0.430" is a long way from 0.625", the specified ID.  Even the cheapo drain hose that I bought for a dehumidifier measures 0.530" on a rated 1/2" ID hose hose.  Flexilla is just trying to save a buck and foisting inferior and substandard product to unsuspecting buyers.Not recommended.
title: Hose end design is undersized can't use anti-kink spring in hose reel

review_content: This hose DOES stay un kinked much better than any hose I have every had - almost to the point of not kinking at all. Almost. It really is much less kinky than even the high $ other brands I have tried over the years. I use a hose almost solely for washing my car. Move around a bit - this one rocks. The spinning fittings on each end are even more helpful than I thought they would be. Only drawback - although I LOVE this color - it's beyond nasty looking almost instantly. Super dirty - I haven't used it on anything other than my pressured washed driveway either. It's really strange honestly. Just covered with black stains. I would guess some are from my tires ? author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2021
review_content: Look... Flexzilla makes the best air hose around.  This garden hose is the same stuff enlarged.  Now.. if you coil this hose up in a tub..etc.  IF you try to just pull it out to use... it will NOT pull itself straight.  It will KINK at every loop as its being pulled.  That's because what you get in flexible... you give up it structural integrity.those heavy rubber  hoses will pull straight.... NOT this one.  Now.. its not a big hassle to twist the hose as you pull......but if you are old like me... and have arthritis...  it can be a big pain.  Its great for just moving it around cause its light.  So...  you want light... get it.  Or if you hang it or use a hose reel... go for it.
title: Nice hose.... will kink.....

author: Cda Canuck
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2020
review_content: I'm not impressed so far. The hose is light and easy to pull around. And the couplings are nice. But that's the end of its good qualities. It seemingly wants to stay in a permanent coil. Maybe from the way it was packaged. I've had it unpackaged for several weeks and it still wants to coil. When you pull it straight the coils link. The hose is very difficult to use and kinks very easily.  It definitely is going lto hose heaven early. Additonal review - I'm going to donate this hose to someone I hate. It's 75' of misery first when you uncoil it ≈∫ and then again when you attempt to recoil it.

author: MrsArway
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2020
review_content: This hose is horribly heavy when filled with water and you're lugging it around a large yard to water your flowers on the various sides of the house.  Not impressed with the "anti-kink" feature.  The brand name sprayer is also disappointing in that the handle isn't made for larger hands (it's weirdly small) and there's no way to control the water pressure.  Hose was bulky and awkward to coil after using and is so GREEN I think you can see it from space.  Maybe if you leave it out and use a shorter length it wouldn't be a big deal (mine is 100') but I used it twice before giving up lugging it (and tripping on it).  I will say it's a sturdy hose and the connectors are awesome.  Too bad they're connected to this hose.
title: HEAVY!!!

author: Scott
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2021
review_content: 5/20/21I am a big fan of the follow up type reviews so I plan to do this. This is my initial review and I plan to update as I go. I just got the hose yesterday.The swivel feature is genius, it (almost) completely eliminates kinking and knotting. The hose is a fair weight, it slides on the ground well, I really dig the color.I am just generally listing things here, no particular pros or cons right now. Overall I would recommend this hose right out of the gate. I plan to continue to review as time goes on. For the record, this hose is used to water plants, occasionally run a sprinkler, and run a pressure washer.
title: Overall good, time will tell.

author: Christine Zimmerman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2021
review_content: Bought one of these at Lowes on the clearance rack. Took home and it was immediately stolen by my mother because of the weight.  Hooked it up for her and used it. The very same day I ordered one at full price from Amazon.  Best hose ever.  It's so light and flexible and soft that it's a relative joy to use.  I can't say I've ever given a lot of thought to hose weight and flex before. It's just a darned hose, right?Wrong!  This hose will entice you away from your 3/4" Craftsman heavy duty 100' solid rubber with reinforced mesh core no tangle ribbing coil spring hose guard and lifetime warranty just because you're not worn out after hauling it around the yard.  While winding the Craftsman back up IS an upper body workout,  I think after a long day of yard work the Flexzilla will be my go to hose brand from now on.As far as testing goes, the Flexzilla doesn't balloon at the fittings with high pressure, doesn't kink while being pulled and withstands at least one attack by a toy poodle without puncturing
title: So Green and Light

author: S. Bachtel
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2021
review_content: Potentially the worst hose ever. Purchased thinking a ‚Äúsupple‚Äù hose might work well in colder temps. From day one this hose kinks at every opportunity. Basically performs like a 10 year old, worn out hose. Many times I‚Äôll get multiple kinks in a row. Something about how the casing is wrapped makes it very hard to loop up when done. author: Eli
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2019
review_content: I was excited about this hose.  Work 3 times.  The swivel grip fell off.  The end for attachments is connected to the hose with a barbed type fitting then clamped on.  While using the hose the end just shot off from the rest off the hose.  I can't clamp it to fix it because it will create an oval and cause leaking.I also had the black moldy growth that others have mentioned.
title: Wish I had as much luck as everyone else

author: T. Cloud
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2020
review_content: I really liked this hose for the first 2 years I had it. Light weight, didn't kink, rolled up nicely on the hose reel.  After about 18 months of use, a small hole formed and I repaired it with some compression tape. A few months later, 2 more holes have formed and the hose is useless now.  At $100 price-point, I'd expect to get more than 2 years of life out of a hose, especially one that I've always made sure to take care of store properly.  I also experienced the discoloring many others have complained about, but it's a hose that sits outside 365 days a year... so didn't really bother me that much.Debating what hose I should get now, don't think I'll be replacing it with another flexilla product... it just doesn't last.
title: Worked great for 2 years, then starting bursting holes everywhere

author: Straight_Talk
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2019
review_content: This initially is a nice flexible and light weight hose at first, but decomposes like no other I have seen.Update - 2020 July 10After having this hose for a little over a year, I have lowered my rating to two stars.  The hose is soft and flexible, but unfortunately it seems to have developed an increasing number of leaks.  At this point, there are about eight or nine leaks in the hose.  The number grows regularly. I have three other hoses of different brands, all of which are years older, and none of which have any leaks. Certainly this new hose is a significant disappointment.Another thought ... the purchased garden hose eventualy does develop spots of black mold on it as other reviewers have described.I can't recommend this hose because of its unbelievably fast deterioration rate.Final thought -- When you read reviews of this hose, recommend you consider ignoring comments from purchasers who have only owned this hose a few months or less.Update - 2020 July 15More leaks.  Out with the trash today.  Approximately $70 worth of hose lasted about one year of light use.Reduced to one star.
title: Flexible and Light Weight - Ultimately Terrible Quality

author: Sarscrap
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2020
review_content: False claims. The product claims that it 1)WON‚ÄôT KINK UNDER PRESSURE, 2)EASY TO COIL.Unrolled it out of the box, and immediately upon applying water pressure it developed numerous kinks. Hose claims to have "no memory" and be "easy to coil" - except (like every other hose) you have to provide a slight twist as you coil, and you have to "go with the memory" to roll it. Further, because of how it was originally rolled up, the memory of the twist "reverses" halfway through coiling.Last, I have to agree that the hose does not perform like a 5/8 inch hose. I reconnected my old, patched 5/8 inch hose to my sprinkler, and it throws a good 15' further on the old hose, than this new 5/8 inch hose.Save your money, go to a garden center and buy a real hose.
title: Read the reviews, not just the score

author: Alex R.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2020
review_content: I bought 2 of these hoses, in different lengths, at the same time a couple years ago. One hose, in 75 foot length, lives outside all year on a hose reel. The second, shorter version (50 feet), lives in the garage when not being used. The outdoor version looks like the pictures shared in the reviews of a moldy mess. I am searching for a replacement right now. As soon as find one, this one will be trashed. (If you own this hose and it is moldy, I suggest you wear at least 7 mil nitrile gloves, which are almost impossible to find right now, or, MUCH SAFER, replace your hose.)The hose that lives in the garage gets 5 stars. It works great, is fairly lightweight, does not kink if uncoiled properly, and has no mold. None.So if you don't store this hose outside you will get many years of faithful, clean use out of it. If your hose is routinely stored outside, please look elsewhere for a hose.
title: Depends on how this hose is stored

author: Red
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2018
review_content: UPDATE REVIEW: ( January 2019)After 13 months, we see black spots on the outside of the hose, not very attractive but it‚Äôs still working like a champ.I trying clean it out but it doesn‚Äôt come off.I got this for the front yard, now in 2019 I‚Äôm here to purchase one for the back yard since the old one (different brand) is going.Last year I paid $53 for this hose and now it‚Äôs $65.No doubt it‚Äôs a great product taking away the black spots that started to show after 10 months. title: Very happy with this hose....

author: Bruce D.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2018
review_content: This hose is all it‚Äôs cracked up to be. Flexible and light weight. Won‚Äôt kink when full of water, but empty it‚Äôs does so easily. This is the trade off for a hose that is easily handled when dragging a far distance, moving sprinklers around, etc.. after one month I have already managed to tear the outer covering while paying off of a hose reel. title: Different and better!

author: FH
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2020
review_content: I have several Flexzilla garden hoses and love them. So, it was a no-brainer for me to order two of the 10' hoses for a project on which I'm working. The hoses have two MAJOR problems. First off, the composition of the hose is different. It HAS a very good memory! When they came they were coiled in their package. I took them out of the package and they retained their coiled shape. I then ran hot water through one of them to get it to loosen up. No deal! It still retained its coiled shape. On top of that, when it bent, there was a kink that reduced the water flow- just like all of the cheap garden hoses on the market!Then, on top of all of that, Flexzilla decided that they need to put new grips on the ends of the hose that allow you to tighten or remove the hose from another. Not to my liking! Give me the old-style anytime! These add bulk to the ends of the hose that I don't like.I'm very disappointed in Flexzilla for making the composition change! Not sure why companies do this when they have a good product already!My advice is to look for the old-style hose- the ones that don't have the new grip on them.
title: Flexzilla "new style"- avoid it!

author: M. S. Anderson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2020
review_content: I have had this for a season and it is a great hose. It is easy to use and very flexible. I like the color although I discovered that dragging it over old asphalt results in browning/blackening marks on the hose.The one difficult thing was that the cowling around the hose interferes with some of the things I wish to screw into the end. Then I could plug in my Dramm Heavy Duty brass Shutoff Valve and my high pressure nozzle.Even with that limitation I think this hose seems exceptional and I have owned dozens of hoses over the years.
title: Great hose and does what it says.

author: Becky F.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2019
review_content: UPDATE: After two months of use (just watering plants at foundation of my home) the hose cracked. Very disappointed. I bought two 100 feet hoses because I may need them both for to control a burn pile. The deadline to return both is past. Hopefully rubber cement and pieces of rubber will fix the crack.My precious 4 star rating is now a one star.
title: Easily cracks-not for country terrain.

author: Albino Rhino
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2020
review_content: I've had this hose for several years now and use it strictly for car washing. It's definitely lightweight and easy to coil back up on the wall mounted hose reel. But the trade off is the hose kinks easily which really isn't a problem if you lay it out uncoiled on the ground before turning on the hose spicket. The good thing is the hose has no memory like other vinyl or rubber hoses where they kink and seem to always occur in the same spot. This hose is definitely different in that aspect it doesn't rekink over and over in the same spot. On a side note
title: if you leave the water on and coil the hose back up on the reel the loops come out more evenly sized this works on any garden hose. Afterwards then turn the spicket off.

author: Anon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2020
review_content: This hose seems well built and resists kinks. It is also yellow so visibility is also great. One thing that I would have wanted to improve would have been the connectors. They are a little lightweight, but since I use the hose rarely, it works for me. Ideally I would have preferred some metal connectors which are available in the more expensive hoses made by Flexzilla, but for the price, this is an excellent hose.One thing to keep in mind while spooling it is to develop a rhythm to make sure the hose does not tangle. When it is packed it is sort of twisted to make sure it fits in the smallest box, but it needs to be unspooled and untwisted to make sure it is easy to spool when you are using it.

author: VLA
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2020
review_content: Purchased this hose to connect to my pressure washer because it was light weight.  Had high expectations based on many positive reviews. author: Rich H.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2018
review_content: Good: Light and flexible, much easier to work with than your typical garden hose.  Very sturdy connectors.  It WILL kink under pressure if you give it enough of an excuse, but it does have less tendency to do so than most hoses I've used.Bad: While it is relatively kink-resistant with the water on, it kinks very easily when not under pressure. If it's pinched tightly enough, the kinks can remain when the water is turned on.  This is a near-nitpick; all you have to do to avoid it is to make sure the hose is kink-free before turning the water on.  Somewhat expensive for a garden hose.Ugly: Nothing, unless you dislike neon green.  I like it.Bottom line: This costs a third- to half-again as much as a quality regular hose, but I think it's worth it. I'm satisfied enough that I'll probably buy another one.  Five stars.
title: Pricey, but does the job well

author: Reign Security
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2021
review_content: We operate an Animal Rescue and over the last 10 years we have went through maybe 10 different water hoses, mostly different companies.  We now use two of these water hoses and are buying another one now so I figured I would write a review since it is such a great hose.  The wife loves how it spins around to stop from tangling up and it is a very light weight hose for this fact as well, very easy to handle compared to those heavy-duty thick hoses.  It is also very stretchy so you can pull it and it just snaps back straight, we do not own nor have I owned a hose that acts this way.
title: If not the best hose, it is one of the best.

author: Cooper
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2021

author: Amazon Customer

author: Tony NYC
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2021

author: Garesfun
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2019

author: J L W

author: D. Swager
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2019
review_content: I actually love the hose itself and the large rotating handles on the ends.  It makes connecting and disconnecting easy. I've tried a few solutions, but it may come to cutting the big handle off and going with a very short connector.
title: Hose is great, but your reel might not work with it.

author: Dominguez
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2021
review_content: The garden hose works like I expected. It was light weight and the Swivel Grip is very ingenious for a garden hose. Help keep the hose from twisting on itself like others I have purchased before. I recommend this garden hose for residential use. I thing is to buy the length you need. Bought a 100ft commercial garden hose from a membership club thinking the price was a steal. Lasted only one year due to damage. But the weight and the kinks were just annoying.
title: Flexibility

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2020
review_content: I do extensive research on almost everything I buy and this hose was no exception. I bought it specifically because it was "heavy duty" , "flexible" and "safe for drinking water". author: Margot
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2019
review_content: This is hands down the best hose I've ever used, and I've gone through quite a few looking for one that's easy to maneuver. I've tried hoses that claimed to be kink free that definitely aren't, even when kink-free is in the name . This hose doesn't kink, not in any serious way like some others I've tried. author: Laura
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2020
review_content: Love the swivel handle, we've had a different flexzilla for a year and really like it, so purchased this one. author: Sandy N
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2020

author: RLO1016
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2021
review_content: It has taken many weeks for this hose to relax enough to curl in a large hose holder designed to hold a 100 ft hose, even though it is 75 ft.  And it kinked in the holder. author: Frank48
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2020
review_content: The hose works great and seamed to add additional pressure to the water.  Has good construction and kinking is almost no existent.  Not that easy to handle.  Bought Aug of 2019 over time the hose got really sticky.  I scrubbed it off with simple green and a green scrub pad.  Would like to know if it reacts with chemicals or something to create this stickiness.  Otherwise, this is a nice hose but hard to handle and your hands become covered in goo.  I do not recommend this hose

author: Justin M.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2020
review_content: I like how flexible and relatively light this hose is. It does resist kinking but will kink in certain circumstances. Nothing that a quick flip of the hose won't fix though. And it happens way less often than with my old hose.I like how the end connectors twist freely even when connected. This is nice when using a nozzle and you can twist it where you want it without fighting the hose.
title: Flexible and relatively light

author: Nancy Ruczynski
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2020
review_content: I thought this hose would be good, because I have another one of the same brand, and it is a nice, flexible hose that doesn't kink.  However, the end of the hose that is supposed to connect to the hose reel, as well as the opposite end connecting to the sprinkler, didn't seal tightly.  I tried many times, but water was spurting out around each area that was supposed to connect.  I end up with puddles of water in my yard around the hose reel and the sprinkler.  I kept trying to tighten the connections as best I could, trying to re-thread the connection, but I just ended up getting a bad blister.  It seems like the ends of this hose are not precisely the size they need to be in order to screw into the hose reel or the sprinkler.  (I checked if I had made a mistake and had accidentally tried to connect the sprinkler end to the hose reel end, but no, that was not the problem -- I had done it right.)  I am very disappointed because this product had a lot of good reviews.
title: both ends of hose don't connect tightly -- water spurting out!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2021
review_content: I've owned dozens of hoses these last few decades - some cheaper and some a lot more expensive than this hose.  I never would get excited when I needed to pull those hoses out. There's something so enjoyable handling this hose.  perhaps it's the rubbery/elastic feel that reinforces the knowledge that you don't have to worry about kinks (never have I had a problem with kinks).  Maybe it's that it's so much lighter than other hoses. I don't know the reason, but even after a couple of years of ownership, part of me still gets excited when I need to pull out the hose.
title: A treat every time I need to use the hose
